task_summary: Pick the disk from the table using the robot arm, as shown in the frames. The disk is a small, white cylindrical object on the top shelf. The robot first perceives the disk, approaches, aligns above for grasp, closes the gripper, verifies grasp, and retreats.

task_long_description.overview: This episode shows a blue robotic arm tasked with picking up a white disk from the top-right compartment of a black shelving unit in a clean indoor lab environment. The disk is spatially isolated as the clear target among other distracting objects (such as a flower). The robot executes visual search, approaches above the disk, prepares the gripper, plans a top-style grasp, aligns, grasps at pose, verifies in-gripper, and retreats after securing the disk. Main constraints are accurate perception of the disk, safe approach, proper grasp strategy, and stable pickup.
preconditions: Disk is present and visible on the shelf.
Robot arm and gripper are operational.
stepwise_plan: Visually seek and confirm visibility of the disk.
Move end-effector above disk at safe height.
Open gripper to set grasp width.
Approach and align to pre-grasp position.
Execute grasp at pose using top strategy.
Retreat and prepare for further tasks.
success_criteria: Robot arm approaches and aligns above disk.
failure_and_recovery: Disk not detected: repeat scan up to 3 times.
Grasp fails: retry grasp at pose.
Object slips during pickup: abort or try a different strategy.
Collision detected: halt and log event.
task_long_description.termination: Tree completes when robot retreats after confirming disk is securely held in gripper.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the disk is visible to the robot's perception system.
Performs visual scanning in a grid pattern to locate the disk.
Detects the disk's exact position and orientation.
Moves the end effector above the disk at specified offset.
Opens the gripper to a width suitable for grasping the disk.
Computes a grasp pose for a top-down grasp.
Approaches and aligns the end effector to the computed grasp pose.
Executes the grasp at the computed pose.
Verifies that the disk is securely held in the gripper.
Moves the arm away from the shelf after picking the disk.

failure_modes: Gripper fails to close or does not hold disk
Collision with shelf during approach or retreat
recovery_strategy: Retry scan up to the allowed limit
Abort or alert operator on grasp failure
Reset arm position and retry on collision
assumptions: The 'disk' is interpreted from the white cylindrical object in frames; instruction is generic but frames clarify the target.
Contact sheet sequence matches a standard pick with top grasp, no explicit force or tolerance specified in instruction.
No place or transfer operation observed; tree terminates after pick and retreat.

expected_success_criteria: Disk picked and held in gripper after retreat
Operation completes within node timeout limits
